member.summary: Information about a file, including the URL of the file and the URL of the fileâ€™s thumbnail. The RBM platform serves content from a cache, but an agent can force the RBM platform to fetch a new version of the content and refresh the cache.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentContentMessage.FileName
member.summary: The unique name of a file. The RBM platform returns a file name when an agent uploads a file.

member.summary: A standalone rich card.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentContentMessage.Suggestions
member.summary: A list of suggested replies and suggested actions that appear as a list of suggestion chips following the associated agent message. Maximum 11 suggestions. The chips only display when the associated agent message is the most recent message within the conversation (including both agent and user messages). The user can tap a suggested reply to send the text reply back to the agent or tap a suggested action to initiate a native action on the device.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentContentMessage.Text
member.summary: Text encoded in UTF-8.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentEvent.MessageId
member.summary: The ID of the user message that the agent event pertains to. This field is only applicable for agent events of type READ.

member.summary: This field is set by the RBM platform. Do not include it when creating an agent message. The field resolves the time when the event is sent to the user.

member.summary: Request to check if users are RBM-reachable.

member.summary: Optional. The agent's unique identifier. Defined by RCS Business Messaging.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersRequest.Users
member.summary: List of users' phone numbers in E.164 format.

member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.summary: Response with RBM-reachability user data.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersResponse.ReachableRandomSampleUserCount
member.summary: Count of phone numbers from the randomly selected list that are RCS-reachable across all carriers, regardless of the agent's launch status. The ratio between this value and total_random_sample_user_count can approximate the potential reach for a list of users.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersResponse.ReachableUsers
member.summary: List of users' phone numbers that RBM can reach. Only includes users on carriers that the agent is launched on.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersResponse.TotalRandomSampleUserCount
member.summary: Count of phone numbers randomly selected from reachable_users. Typically, this value is ~75% of the total requested phone numbers. This value is `0` if the count of requested phone numbers is less than 500.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersResponse.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ContentInfo
member.summary: Message containing the content information.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ContentInfo.FileUrl
member.summary: Publicly reachable URL of the file. The RBM platform determines the MIME type of the file from the content-type field in the HTTP headers when the platform fetches the file. The content-type field must be present and accurate in the HTTP response from the URL. Recommended maximum file size of 100 MB.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ContentInfo.ForceRefresh
member.summary: If set, the RBM platform fetches the file and thumbnail from the specified URLs, even if the platform has cached copies of the file (and/or of the thumbnail).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ContentInfo.ThumbnailUrl
member.summary: (Optional, for image and video files only) Publicly reachable URL of the thumbnail. Maximum size of 100 kB. If you don't provide a thumbnail URL, the RBM platform displays a blank placeholder thumbnail until the user's device downloads the file. Depending on the user's setting, the file may not download automatically and may require the user to tap a download button.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ContentInfo.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.summary: Request for creating file.

member.summary: Blob file reference. This will be propagated by scotty agent automatically.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest.ContentDescription
member.summary: Optional. Text description of the file's content. Screen readers use this description to help users with disabilities understand what the file contains.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest.FileUrl
member.summary: Optional. Publicly available URL of the file. The RBM platform determines the MIME type of the file from the content-type field in the HTTP headers when fetching the file. Supported image content types: image/jpeg, image/jpg, image/gif, image/png. Supported video content types: video/h263, video/m4v, video/mp4, video/mpeg, video/mpeg4, video/webm.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest.MediaRequestInfo
member.summary: Media request info populated by Scotty server. This will be propagated by scotty agent automatically.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest.ThumbnailUrl
member.summary: Optional. Publicly available URL of the thumbnail corresponding to the file. If this field is not set, then the RBM platform automatically generates a thumbnail from the file. The RBM platform determines the MIME type of the file from the content-type field in the HTTP headers when fetching the file. Supported image content types: image/jpeg, image/jpg, image/gif, image/png.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.summary: Opens the user's default dialer app with the agent-specified phone number filled in.

member.summary: The phone number in E.164 format, for example, +12223334444.

member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent
member.summary: Dialogflow event triggered by the RBM Platform. With events, an agent can match an intent without using language as an input. Parameters enable personalized responses. For example, with the input `{ "eventName": "welcome_event", "parameters": { "name": "Sam" } }`, a Dialogflow agent can create the response `"Hello Sam! What can I do for you today?"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent.EventName
member.summary: The unique identifier of the event. For example, `RBM_WELCOME_EVENT`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent.LanguageCode
member.summary: The language of this query. For a list of language codes, see Language Support. Before a Dialogflow agent can use a language, the language must be enabled in the Dialogflow console. Queries in the same session can specify different languages. If a language isn't specified, Dialogflow uses the agent's default language. do not necessarily need to specify the same language.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent.Name
member.summary: This field is set by the RBM platform. Don't include it when creating an agent message. The field resolves "phones/{E.164}/dialogflowMessages/{messageId}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format and {messageId} is the agent-assigned ID of the RBM agent message.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent.Parameters
member.summary: (Optional) Parameters associated with the event.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.Empty
member.summary: A generic empty message that you can re-use to avoid defining duplicated empty messages in your APIs. A typical example is to use it as the request or the response type of an API method. For instance: service Foo { rpc Bar(google.protobuf.Empty) returns (google.protobuf.Empty); } The JSON representation for `Empty` is empty JSON object `{}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.Empty.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.summary: Server-assigned unique name of the file resource, which an agent can use to identify the file when sending messages. The format is "files/{uid}", where {uid} is a unique ID.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.File.ETag

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataBlobstore2Info.ReadToken
member.summary: The blob read token. Needed to read blobs that have not been replicated. Might not be available until the final call.

member.summary: Metadata passed from Blobstore -> Scotty for a new GCS upload. This is a signed, serialized blobstore2.BlobMetadataContainer proto which must never be consumed outside of Bigstore, and is not applicable to non-GCS media uploads.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataBlobstore2Info.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia
member.summary: A sequence of media data references representing composite data. Introduced to support Bigstore composite objects. For details, visit http://go/bigstore-composites.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia.BlobRef
member.summary: Blobstore v1 reference, set if reference_type is BLOBSTORE_REF This should be the byte representation of a blobstore.BlobRef. Since Blobstore is deprecating v1, use blobstore2_info instead. For now, any v2 blob will also be represented in this field as v1 BlobRef.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia.Blobstore2Info
member.summary: Blobstore v2 info, set if reference_type is BLOBSTORE_REF and it refers to a v2 blob.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia.CosmoBinaryReference
member.summary: A binary data reference for a media download. Serves as a technology-agnostic binary reference in some Google infrastructure. This value is a serialized storage_cosmo.BinaryReference proto. Storing it as bytes is a hack to get around the fact that the cosmo proto (as well as others it includes) doesn't support JavaScript. This prevents us from including the actual type of this field.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia.Crc32cHash
member.summary: crc32.c hash for the payload.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataCompositeMedia.Inline

member.summary: Describes what the field reference contains.

member.summary: SHA-1 hash for the payload.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo
member.summary: Detailed Content-Type information from Scotty. The Content-Type of the media will typically be filled in by the header or Scotty's best_guess, but this extended information provides the backend with more information so that it can make a better decision if needed. This is only used on media upload requests from Scotty.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo.BestGuess
member.summary: Scotty's best guess of what the content type of the file is.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo.FromBytes
member.summary: The content type of the file derived by looking at specific bytes (i.e. "magic bytes") of the actual file.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo.FromFileName
member.summary: The content type of the file derived from the file extension of the original file name used by the client.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo.FromHeader
member.summary: The content type of the file as specified in the request headers, multipart headers, or RUPIO start request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataContentTypeInfo.FromUrlPath
member.summary: The content type of the file derived from the file extension of the URL path. The URL path is assumed to represent a file name (which is typically only true for agents that are providing a REST API).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataDiffChecksumsResponse.ChecksumsLocation
member.summary: Exactly one of these fields must be populated. If checksums_location is filled, the server will return the corresponding contents to the user. For details on the format of the checksums, see http://go/scotty-diff-protocol.

member.summary: Deprecated, use one of explicit hash type fields instead. Algorithm used for calculating the hash. As of 2011/01/21, "MD5" is the only possible value for this field. New values may be added at any time.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataMedia.CosmoBinaryReference
member.summary: A binary data reference for a media download. Serves as a technology-agnostic binary reference in some Google infrastructure. This value is a serialized storage_cosmo.BinaryReference proto. Storing it as bytes is a hack to get around the fact that the cosmo proto (as well as others it includes) doesn't support JavaScript. This prevents us from including the actual type of this field.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataMedia.Crc32cHash
member.summary: For Scotty Uploads: Scotty-provided hashes for uploads For Scotty Downloads: (WARNING: DO NOT USE WITHOUT PERMISSION FROM THE SCOTTY TEAM.) A Hash provided by the agent to be used to verify the data being downloaded. Currently only supported for inline payloads. Further, only crc32c_hash is currently supported.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataMedia.HashVerified
member.summary: For Scotty uploads only. If a user sends a hash code and the backend has requested that Scotty verify the upload against the client hash, Scotty will perform the check on behalf of the backend and will reject it if the hashes don't match. This is set to true if Scotty performed this verification.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.GdataMedia.IsPotentialRetry
member.summary: |is_potential_retry| is set false only when Scotty is certain that it has not sent the request before. When a client resumes an upload, this field must be set true in agent calls, because Scotty cannot be certain that it has never sent the request before due to potential failure in the session state persistence.

member.summary: Represents an amount of money with its currency type.

member.summary: The three-letter currency code defined in ISO 4217.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.Money.Nanos
member.summary: Number of nano (10^-9) units of the amount. The value must be between -999,999,999 and +999,999,999 inclusive. If `units` is positive, `nanos` must be positive or zero. If `units` is zero, `nanos` can be positive, zero, or negative. If `units` is negative, `nanos` must be negative or zero. For example $-1.75 is represented as `units`=-1 and `nanos`=-750,000,000.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.Money.Units
member.summary: The whole units of the amount. For example if `currencyCode` is `"USD"`, then 1 unit is one US dollar.

member.summary: (Optional) A timestamp of when the payment request expires. If a payment request expires, the request becomes invalid. If you specify a timestamp, the RCS-enabled messaging app doesn't verify an expiration time with the RBM agent. If you don't specify a timestamp, the payment request only expires if the agent flags the request as expired via the experation check webhook.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ViewLocationAction
member.summary: Opens the user's default map app and selects the agent-specified location or searches around the user's location given an agent-specified query.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ViewLocationAction.Label
member.summary: (Optional) The label of the pin dropped at lat_long.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ViewLocationAction.LatLong
member.summary: (Optional) The latitude and longitude of the specified location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ViewLocationAction.Query
member.summary: (Optional, only supported on Android Messages clients) Rather than specify a lat_long (and optionally, a label), the agent can instead specify a query string. For default map apps that support search functionality (including Google Maps), tapping this suggested action results in a location search centered around the user's current location. If the query is sufficiently specific, then agents can use it to select any location in the world. For instance, setting the query string to "Growing Tree Bank" will show all Growing Tree Bank locations in the user's vicinity. Setting the query string to "1600 Amphitheater Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043" will select that specific address, regardless of the user's location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.ViewLocationAction.ETag
member.summary: The ETag of the item.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.FilesResource.Create(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.CreateFileRequest)
member.summary: Uploads a file for use in media or rich card messages. The agent provides the URL or binary of the file and (optionally) the URL of the corresponding thumbnail file. The RBM platform caches the file for 60 days and returns a unique name that you can use to identify the file when sending agent messages. To upload a file binary, make an HTTP POST request to the Upload URI, omit the `fileUrl` field from the JSON request body, and specify the binary as the POST request body. For example, use the `--upload-file` cURL flag with the fully qualified file path of the binary file.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.AgentEventsResource.Create(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentEvent,System.String)
member.summary: Sends an event from the agent to a user. Agent events can be used to indicate that the agent has read a message from the user or that the agent is in the process of typing (which adds a human element to the RBM experience). If RBM can't reach the user, the RBM platform returns `404 NOT_FOUND`. Unlike agent messages, agent events cannot be revoked after sending.
member.param: "phones/{E.164}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format. For example, for a user with the US phone number +1-222-333-4444, the value would be phones/+12223334444, and the resulting endpoint would be https://rcsbusinessmessaging.googleapis.com/v1/phones/+12223334444/agentEvents.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.AgentMessagesResource.Create(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.AgentMessage,System.String)
member.summary: Sends a message from the agent to a user. The user must be RCS enabled and reachable by the RBM platform in order for the agent to successfully send a message. When the message has been successfully sent, the call returns with no error. Otherwise, the agent receives an error code. If the user is online, the RBM platform delivers the message right away. Otherwise, the RBM platform queues the message and delivered it when the user is next online. The RBM platform ignores any agent message sent with an ID that was used by an earlier message or event sent from the same agent. Agent messages can be revoked between the time that they are sent and the time that they are delivered.
member.param: "phones/{E.164}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format. For example, with the US phone number +1-222-333-4444, the value would be phones/+12223334444, and the resulting endpoint would be https://rcsbusinessmessaging.googleapis.com/v1/phones/+12223334444/agentMessages.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.AgentMessagesResource.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Revokes an agent message that has been sent but not yet delivered. If the RBM platform successfully revokes a message, then the message is deleted from the userâ€™s message queue and is never delivered. This method immediately returns 200 OK, whether or not the message was successfully revoked. There is a small chance that the agent may initiate a revocation while the RBM platform is in the process of delivering the message. In these rare cases, the agent receives a DELIVERED user event for the message shortly after initiating the revocation request.
member.param: "phones/{E.164}/agentMessages/{messageId}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format and {messageId} is the agent-assigned ID of the agent message that should be revoked. For example, with the US phone number +1-222-333-4444 and an agent message with the ID "12345xyz", the resulting endpoint would be https://rcsbusinessmessaging.googleapis.com/v1/phones/+12223334444/agentMessages/12345xyz.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.DialogflowMessagesResource.Create(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.DialogflowEvent,System.String)
member.summary: Prompts a Dialogflow agent to send messages through an RBM agent. If Dialogflow integration isn't enabled for an RBM agent, this method returns `403 PERMISSION_DENIED`. When an RBM agent is integrated with a Dialogflow agent, this method triggers an event in the Dialogflow agent. The RBM Platform routes responses from Dialogflow to the user's device and routes messages from the user back to the Dialogflow agent. If a Dialogflow intent defines multiple responses, the RBM Platform sends users one message per defined response. If you contact a webhook with Dialogflow fulfillment, the fulfillment request includes the following information in the payload: Field Description rbm_user_phone_number The user's phone number. rbm_share_location_response The user's location, if they tapped the share location suggested action.
member.param: "phones/{E.164}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number

member.name: T:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.DialogflowMessagesResource.CreateRequest
member.summary: Prompts a Dialogflow agent to send messages through an RBM agent. If Dialogflow integration isn't enabled for an RBM agent, this method returns `403 PERMISSION_DENIED`. When an RBM agent is integrated with a Dialogflow agent, this method triggers an event in the Dialogflow agent. The RBM Platform routes responses from Dialogflow to the user's device and routes messages from the user back to the Dialogflow agent. If a Dialogflow intent defines multiple responses, the RBM Platform sends users one message per defined response. If you contact a webhook with Dialogflow fulfillment, the fulfillment request includes the following information in the payload: Field Description rbm_user_phone_number The user's phone number. rbm_share_location_response The user's location, if they tapped the share location suggested action.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.TestersResource.Create(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.Tester,System.String)
member.summary: Invites a user to test an agent. The invited user must be RCS-enabled and reachable by the RBM platform. When an agent invites a user to become a tester, an RBM platform management agent sends a message to the user asking for confirmation that she wants to be a tester of the agent. Once the user confirms, she becomes a tester. An agent that has not yet launched can only interact with users who are testers of that agent. If an unlaunched agent attempts to send a message, event, or capability callback to a non-tester, the RBM platform returns a `403 PERMISSION_DENIED` error. An agent can send 20 tester requests each day with a total maximum of 200 tester requests. If you send tester requests above those limits, the RBM platform returns a `429 RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED` response.
member.param: "phones/{E.164}", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format. For example, with the US phone number +1-222-333-4444, the resulting endpoint would be https://rcsbusinessmessaging.googleapis.com/v1/phones/+12223334444/testers/.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.PhonesResource.GetCapabilities(System.String)
member.summary: Get the RBM-related capabilities of a user. The returned payload specifies whether a user can be reached with RBM and, if so, which RBM features the user supports. If the user can't be reached with RBM, the RBM platform returns `404 NOT_FOUND`. An agent that isn't launched can only request capabilities for users who are testers of that agent. If an unlaunched agent requests the capabilities of a non-tester, the RBM platform returns `403 PERMISSION_DENIED`.
member.param: This field resolves to "phones/{E.164}/capabilities", where {E.164} is the user's phone number in E.164 format. For example, for a user with the US phone number +1-222-333-4444, the resulting endpoint is https://rcsbusinessmessaging.googleapis.com/v1/phones/+12223334444/capabilities.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.UsersResource.BatchGet(Google.Apis.RCSBusinessMessaging.v1.Data.BatchGetUsersRequest)
member.summary: Gets the RCS-enabled phone numbers for a list of users. The returned payload contains a list of RCS-enabled phone numbers reachable by the RBM platform for the specified users. Only phone numbers that are RCS-enabled for a carrier the agent is launched on will be returned. The returned payload also contains values that can be used to estimate the potential reach of a list of phone numbers regardless of the launch status of the agent. Maximum 600 queries per minute (QPM).
